Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Response identifier
Element.Description: A transaction instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the transaction instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: Document date time.

Element.Name: Issue time
Element.Description: Document date time.

Element.Name: Sender information
Element.Description: The party sending an electronic message level response message back to the sending party of the business document.

Element.Name: Sender party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the sender party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Sender party identifier
Element.Description: Consignee (T0036)

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Logistics: Scheme identifier for party identification

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: The name of the Sender Party.

Element.Name: Name of the sender party
Element.Description: The name of the sender oif the document.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: The name of the party legal entity for the sender party.

Element.Name: Sender customers parties legal registration name
Element.Description: The official name of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Logistics: The identification scheme identifier of the despatch customer legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Contry
Element.Description: The residens country for the delivery customer party.

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The contact of the sender party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Receiver information
Element.Description: The party, an electronic message level response was addressed to, and who is supposed to process the message level response. This is the same party as the sender of the business document.

Element.Name: Reciever party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the receiver party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Peppol: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Receiver party identifier
Element.Description: Identification of the Receiver (consignee)

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Logistics: Scheme identifier for party identification.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: The name of the Receiver Party.

Element.Name: Name of the fuel supplier
Element.Description: The name of the receiver.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Receiver party registration name
Element.Description: The registration name of the receiver party.

Element.Name: Reveiver parties legal registration ID
Element.Description: The official ID of the party as registered with the relevant fiscal authority.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Logistics: The identification scheme identifier of the despatch customer legal registration identifier

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city.

Element.Name: Contry
Element.Description: The residens country for the delivery customer party.

Element.Name: Contact name
Element.Description: The contact name.

Element.Name: Telephone
Element.Description: The phone number of the contact.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The electronic mail of the contact.

Element.Name: Document response
Element.Description: The document response is used to indicate the result of business document validation. The element 'cac:DocumentResponse/cac:Response/cbc:ResponseCode' MUST contain the overall result code.

Element.Name: Message response code
Element.Description: A code signifying the type of response

Element.Name: Response textual notes
Element.Description: Used to make any comments or instructions relevant to the response. The use of this element requires manual assessment by the receiver.

Element.Name: Document reference
Element.Description: The document reference is used to provide a reference to the envelope of the business document on which the message level response is based. The message level response message may only cover exactly one business document. The element 'cac:DocumentResponse/cac:DocumentReference/cbc:ID' MUST contain the instance identifier of the envelope of the original business document.

Element.Name: Document identifier
Element.Description: The id of the Despatch- or Receipt advice sent.

Element.Name: Issue date
Element.Description: Document date time.

Element.Name: Issue time
Element.Description: Document date time.

Element.Name: Document type code
Element.Description: Specifies if it is a reference to a Despatch or a Receipt advice.
